intro: Calosanthes, commonly known as the "sweet-scented orchid," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where they thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Calosanthes species are characterized by their delicate, fragrant flowers that often have a sweet, honey-like scent. The plants typically grow as terrestrial herbs with fleshy, hairy stems and linear leaves. They produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
